Html:
Hello guys. I am sorry to post this newbish question here, but i'm doing a litle project for my university..

I need to draw the routes between the points (lat + lng) that i read from a .txt file.

 

Well, everything works great till the moment i try to draw them... the MapRoute route = GMaps.Instance.GetRouteBetweenPoints(start, end, false, (int)map.Zoom); is returning a null value and i have no idea why.

I've searched alot already but i can't fix it.

 

Can you help me?

My visual studio 2008 + mobile 6.0 project: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/14933526/Visualizador%20de%20Rotas.rar

Sorry, it is written at portuguese. If you try to run the app, click at "Verificar tarefas diarias", then click at "Ver rotas" and then click at ">".

 

Thank you in advance!
this function is disabled in mobile, check the forks...

oh noes :((

 

Isn't there a way to bypass this.. or create a similar effect?.. using google maps api.. or even gmaps,net somehow..

 

I can't believe.. :(

 

edit: getting the text would be cool if possible.. like "turn on left... etc etc"
check the forks, it's fixed, and somewhere in the forums is code with directions...

thank you alot radioman!

 

I'm gonna take a look. I have zero experience with the api n stuff, but thanks alot, now i can believe again :)

 

Can you tell me if it is possible to get the direction text by the way?

 

 

Gonna start digging now, thanks.

https://hg01.codeplex.com/forks/tolamac/mobile/rev/d3d23ba66a18

thanks alot, it's working!
